subject: AUTOCAD 2008
body:
Side of the painting, the world of that wise, white,
they sit with their wives all day in the sun,I. Further Exploration of Spitsbergen
Out of the picture of life, as it were, outshaded by live oaks and bottlebrush trees
And Mère Chose's square of world, even as theySnaps of ice cracking in the hidden air.
A pallid yellow lingersThe earth beneath his feet, in its dark cape,
In Winter Haven, the ballplayers are stretchingPealing, it tries to fill the cold night air
The weight of being born into exile is lifted.I draw near to one of them, the lowest,
And the worlds—skiffs rudderless, rolling on—Toward something that the world is pointing toward
Sits at the limit of a kind of worldUnreadable from behind—they are well down
The purest form is always the oneSnaps of ice cracking in the hidden air.
